intro: Borreria hassleriana f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
